prs.title: chore(op-devstack): Don't fail if no conductors are present
prs.truncated_body:
## Overview

Updates the behavior of `l2_network.go`'s `ExtensibleL2Network` implementation to not fail tests if there are no conductors present in the query to fetch the network's conductors. This function is useful for tests that want to gate on configurations that have conductors present. As-is, it's not possible to do so due to the test failing on query.

commits.message:
chore(devstack): Don't fail if no conductors are present

## Overview

Updates the behavior of `l2_network.go`'s `ExtensibleL2Network` implementation to not fail tests if there are no conductors present in the query to fetch the network's conductors. This function is useful for tests that want to gate on configurations that have conductors present. As-is, it's not possible to do so due to the test failing on query.

prs.title: fix: consider floor gas in eth_estimateGas
prs.truncated_body:
## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR

Currently, the binary search in `eth_estimateGas` considers `ErrFloorDataGas` a true error case and terminates gas estimation. Instead, we should handle it as a special case, similar to `ErrIntrinsicGas`.

```
> cast estimate --rpc-url http://l2geth-rpc-0.sepolia.scroll.tech:8545 0x2a03a891add2dc6d0f7b94419086630ba5cb65b6 0x95d89b41 0x

Error: s

commits.message: fix: consider floor gas in eth_estimateGas

prs.title: `config/machine`: zen5 machine target on gcc 15+
prs.truncated_body:
```
nick@nick-dev1:~/firedancer$ MACHINE=linux_gcc_zen5 make -j fdctl
Using MACHINE=linux_gcc_zen5
Using EXTRAS=
"openssl not installed, skipping"
config/machine/linux_gcc_zen5.mk:21: *** Unsupported GCC version 13. Only GCC 14+ is supported for zen5..  Stop.
```

To which I then upgrade to gcc 14, which does not actually support `-mtune=znver5`

So, we support `gcc 15`!

prs.title: Fix "allow trust" test on macOS
prs.truncated_body:
Closes #4717

This test broker because newer versions of clang on macOS has issues with RTTI comparisons for exceptions thrown from template aliases when those template instantiations occur in different compilation units. Specifically, RTTI information wasn't matching up between the template instantiated in `AllowTrustTests.cpp` and the exception thrown from `TestExceptions.cpp`.

The test use

commits.message:
Fix "allow trust" test on macOS

Closes #4717

This test broker because newer versions of clang on macOS has issues
with RTTI comparisons for exceptions thrown from template aliases when
those template instantiations occur in different compilation units.
Specifically, RTTI information wasn't matching up between the template
instantiated in `AllowTrustTests.cpp` and the exception thrown from
`TestExceptions.cpp`.

The test used these templates to allow the same code to test both
`ex_ALLOW_TRUST_*` and `ex_SET_TRUST_LINE_FLAGS_*` exceptions. This
change fixes the issue by replacing the templates by a macro
`REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_VARIANT` to accomplish the same thing while allowing
the use of the actual exception names as input to `REQUIRE_THROWS_AS`.

prs.title: Add Clarity Arguments Validation on `call_function`
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds Clarity arguments validation on `call_function`.

Previously, if a function call was made with incorrect argument types (e.g. `int` instead of `uint`, which are both represented similarly in WASM) or with extra arguments, the call would still go through.

With this change, `call_function` will now validate the number and types of arguments before the `func.call` is made, preventin

* Set the `sign_id` during all signing rounds. It is set to the first 8 bytes of the SHA-256 of the

Currently, during a key rotation, we verify shares *twice.* Here, if we're past the verification window we forgo verifying again since it'd fail & further delay rotating to the new key.

Closes: #1721

signer/src/transaction_coordinator.rs, specifically the 'assert_rotate_key_action.'

prs.title: More limited cut storage
prs.truncated_body: We're storing way too many cuts still, especially notable when there's a lot of chains. This change stores one cut per block height, as well as storing the current cut when the node shuts down.

Add cut storage test
Change-Id: Id0000000e4c25130b32b06ca2edca4f0908a0c94

Simpler limited cut storage 

We're storing way too many cuts still. This change stores one cut per
block height, as well as storing the current cut when the node shuts
down.

prs.title: feat(load2): add contract tests
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

This PR migrates over the existing contract tests from the original load framework into load 2.0. This PR also replaces the type of test used in load 2.0 testing (`ZeroTransferTest` => `RandomTest`).

## How this works

Migration with the following caveats:
- Rather than simple transfers having a high probability of being selected, each test has an equal probab

prs.title: feat: Firewood metrics
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Metrics inside Firewood's code are not yet tracked. This enables them.

## How this works

Firewood implemented a `Gatherer` that can be scraped by prometheus on the global metrics recorder in Rust via FFI.

## How this was tested

Tested locally using `tmpnet`.

## Need to be documented?

Yes.

## Need to update RELEASES.md?

Yes.

prs.title: chore: Update Firewood to v0.0.9
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

New version of Firewood released, has more features for metrics (coming soon).

## How this works

The only breaking change in the Firewood interface removed the need to explicitly state whether a file should be created or not - now Firewood will internally determine whether to create a file or read it, even if the file is empty (e.g. `filepath.Join()` creates a

prs.title: :scissors: remove unused dependencies (Improves compilation time)
prs.truncated_body:
### What does it do?

Removes unused dependencies and adds `check-unused-dependencies` check to the CI

https://nicoan.net/posts/accelerating_compile_times/#removing-unnecessary-dependencies

Tools used: 

- https://github.com/bnjbvr/cargo-machete
- https://github.com/est31/cargo-udeps

Rust flags:

- `RUSTFLAGS=-Wunused-crate-dependencies`

prs.title: test: Disable flaky AtomicRecordsSuite suite
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
* The atomic batch is disabled, so it's not a problem to disable this test suite. The test suite is flaky, and we do have a fix https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-consensus-node/pull/20256, but the `StreamValidator` is failing. Until we figure out a solution, we will disable this suite to unblock the pipeline.

prs.title: chore(release): v2.69.0
prs.truncated_body:
Stable release v2.69.0

### Added
- Added validation to NodeUpdateTransaction and NodeDeleteTransaction ensuring that nodeId is explicitly set before execution. This prevents accidental updates to node 0.0.3 due to protobuf's default uint64 = 0 behavior. [3228](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-js/pull/3228)

### Fixed
- Fixed formatting of the X-User-Agent header in the JavaScript S

commits.message: feat: add pre_process_txs to Subprotocol trait
refactor: asm_stf returns the new state and logs
update docstring and add places for review
add anchor_pre as parameter to process_txs fn
dep: use MohoProgram that has StepOutput
refactor(aux-input-collector): request aux input data opaquely
refactor: move spec into a separate file
refactor: move handling of aux bundle to process stage
feat: add fn to collect aux requests
refactor: move aux data to loader stage

feat: add AsmLog trait and DepositLog implementation

- Add strata-msg-fmt dependency for message formatting
- Create AsmLog trait with TypeId-based serialization/deserialization
- Implement DepositLog with deposit operation details
- Add TypeId support to AsmError enum
- Update lib.rs to expose logs module

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

refactor: restructure ASM log system and implement AsmLogEntry wrapper

- Replace enum-based AsmLog with trait-based system for better type safety
- Add AsmLogEntry wrapper around OwnedMsg for typed log access
- Split log types into separate modules (asm_stf, checkpoint, constants, export, forced_inclusion)
- Update all consumers to use new AsmLogEntry and typed log access
- Remove old log.rs file and update imports

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
refactor: create separate crate for ASM logs
refactor: enhance ASM log type constants with macro and uniqueness test
refactor: split transition file into stf and preprocess

prs.title: STR-1589 Make retry logic for publishing stake txs configurable
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

<!--
Provide a brief summary of the changes and the motivation behind them.
-->
This PR makes the retry logic for publishing stake transactions configurable. Previously, this logic was hardcoded to retry 25 times with a 1-minute delay. This is not suitable for all environments where the signet block times may be different. Furthermore, the value 25 was chosen because it is the desc

commits.message:
duty-tracker: actually persist deposit setup duties on time

turns out this code would *never* persist contract state after
deposit setup processing. This means that we would lose this state
if a node went down.
duty-tracker: use unbounded channels for ouroboros system

prs.title: fix(operator-wallet): move all transactions to V3
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

Changes all transactions to V3 which facilitates the CPFP handles and package relay TRUC combo transactions.
A version-2 transaction cannot spend from a version-3 transaction that has not been confirmed yet.

### Type of Change

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature/Enhancement (non-breaking change which adds functionality or enhances an

commits.message: fix(operator-wallet): move all transactions to V3

commits.message:
duty-tracker: actually persist deposit setup duties on time

turns out this code would *never* persist contract state after
deposit setup processing. This means that we would lose this state
if a node went down.
